intro: Narcissus major var. propinquus, commonly known as the common daffodil, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, yellow flowers and strap-like leaves. The plant is native to Europe and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It blooms in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is widely cultivated in gardens.
